byline.original: By OTTO D. TOLISCHUS Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

snippet: OSLO, Norway, April 1--With grave apprehension but without any outward manifestation of alarm, Norway tonight awaited the speech of Prime Minister Chamberlain tomorrow, which is to elucidate the decisions of the Allied Supreme War Council regardin...

headline.main: OSLO APPREHENSIVE ON PLANS OF ALLIES; Norway Fears Spread of War if Fleet Enters Her Waters to Sever Ore Route to Reich NAZI ACTION HELD SURE In Such an Event Russia Is Expected to Move Too--Hope Put in Allied Disavowals

lead_paragraph: OSLO, Norway, April 1--With grave apprehension but without any outward manifestation of alarm, Norway tonight awaited the speech of Prime Minister Chamberlain tomorrow, which is to elucidate the decisions of the Allied Supreme War Council regarding a strengthening of the Allied blockade and which, in doing so, may hold the issue of war or peace for Scandinavia.
